Remarks:
AuditEvent

The following details are returned as part of the AuditEvent structure if AuditEvent data is included with this resource. For more information about AuditEvent, refer to the FHIR Search Parameters article in the Documentation section of this site.

Name

Description

Is Optional

Is Array

type (coding)

The type of event, either Ancillary Provider Update, Care Team Member Update, or Team Assignment Update.

false

false

recorded (instant)

The time and date the audit event happened.

false

false

agent (agent)

A user or system process that created the audit event. The agent and source elements return the same user.

false

true

agent.Requestor (Boolean)

 Always “True”.

false

false

agent.Who (reference)

 The user who caused the event.

false

false

source (source)

A user or system process that created the audit event. The agent and source elements return the same user.

false

true

source.Observer (reference)

The user who caused the event.

false

false

entity (entity)

A user or system process that created the audit event.

false

true

entity.detail.valueString (true)

Details of what data was changed in the audit event, in the form of a sentence that identifies the item that changed, the line number of the event, and what value the item was set to.

false

true

status.Name: status
status.Description:
Episode statuses of active, finished, or cancelled. These correspond to the Epic episode statuses of active, resolved, and deleted, respectively.

If you don’t specify statuses, the search includes all statuses by default.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The numeric ID for the episode type (I HBD .1) or the episode class (I HBD 130) for the episode type associated with the episode. Use the ValueSet API to determine the system and value for this token.

Example search string for an episode type: urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.5325.1.7.2.726668|<episode type ID>

Example search string for an episode class: urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.5325.1.7.4.726668.130|<episode class ID>

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

admission-source.Name: extension
admission-source.Description: CodeableConcept which indicates where the patient was receiving care prior to home care.

diagnosis.Name: diagnosis
diagnosis.Description: Returns the list of diagnoses associated with the episode. Deleted episodes are not included.

condition.Name: condition
condition.Description: Conditions/problems/diagnoses this episode of care is for

discharge-disposition.Name: extension
discharge-disposition.Description: For discharged patients, the discharge disposition as a codeableConcept.

hospice-admission-status.Name: extension
hospice-admission-status.Description: For hospice patients, the status of their admission to hospice care as a codeableConcept.

hospice-discharge-date.Name: extension
hospice-discharge-date.Description: For discharged hospice patients, the hospice discharge date.

hospice-election-date.Name: extension
hospice-election-date.Description: For hospice patients, the hospice election date.

hospice-prior-days-of-service.Name: extension
hospice-prior-days-of-service.Description: For hospice patients, an integer indicating the number of days on hospice care prior to the election date.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The encoded ID for the episode.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The Patient associated with the episode.

pecos-compliant.Name: extension
pecos-compliant.Description: Boolean indicating whether the attending physician for home health episodes is enrolled in PECOS.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The episode’s start date (for all episodes) and end date (for resolved episodes).

reason-for-discharge.Name: extension
reason-for-discharge.Description: For discharged patients, the reason for the patient being discharged as a codeableConcept.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The episode status of active, finished, or cancelled. These correspond to the Epic episode statuses of active, resolved, and deleted, respectively.

team.Name: team
team.Description: The care team for the episode, as a CareTeam reference. This is distinct from the patient’s longitudinal care team.

transplant-center.Name: extension
transplant-center.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The transplant center managing the episode.

transplant-donor-or-recipient.Name: extension
transplant-donor-or-recipient.Description: Applies only to and is required for transplant episodes. Whether the episode is for a donor or recipient.

transplant-event-admission-date.Name: extension
transplant-event-admission-date.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The date the patient is admitted for transplant.

transplant-event-center-waitlist-date.Name: extension
transplant-event-center-waitlist-date.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The date the patient is waitlisted at the center.

transplant-event-committee-review-date.Name: extension
transplant-event-committee-review-date.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The committee review date.

transplant-event-discharge-date.Name: extension
transplant-event-discharge-date.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The date the patient is discharged after their transplant surgery.

transplant-event-donated-date.Name: extension
transplant-event-donated-date.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The date the donor donates the organ.

transplant-event-evaluation.Name: extension
transplant-event-evaluation.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The dates evaluation begins and ends.

transplant-event-referral-date.Name: extension
transplant-event-referral-date.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The date the patient is referred.

transplant-event-transplanted-date.Name: extension
transplant-event-transplanted-date.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The date the recipient's transplant occurs.

transplant-organ.Name: extension
transplant-organ.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The organ for the episode, as a reference to the BodyStructure resource.

transplant-organ-coordinator.Name: extension
transplant-organ-coordinator.Description: Applies only to and is required for transplant episodes. The transplant coordinator for each organ class on the episode.

transplant-phase-status.Name: extension
transplant-phase-status.Description: Applies only to and is required for transplant episodes. The phase, status, reason, and effective date for the episode.

transplant-waitlist-date.Name: extension
transplant-waitlist-date.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. The date the patient is waitlisted.

transplant-waitlist-score.Name: extension
transplant-waitlist-score.Description: Applies only to transplant episodes. Transplant waitlist score; effective date of the score, expiration date of the score, description of the score, and exceptions associated with the score.

triage-code.Name: extension
triage-code.Description: CodeableConcept which holds the triage code assigned to the patient.

type.Name: type
type.Description: Returns both the ID and the episode class for the episode type associated with the episode.
